page.title: 10HOUSING IN SOUTHREPPS
page.content: Norfolk is rich in flintstones, commonly featured in old cottages, churches, etc. Planning authorities generally insist on Norfolk style new building which incorporates some flintwork. Some flints are "knapped" or "galloted" and embedded in cement. Roofs pitched steeply to accommodate Norfolk Pantiles. Many old barns sympathetically converted into attrac- tive dwellings. Estates have been built to accommodate newcomers which are mainly sympathetic to Norfolk style. Generally bungalows are built away from traditional Norfolk housing. Most new building at this time takes place on Beechlands Park by Mr. Roger Codling.Council housing in Long Lane comprises brick with generally metal windows - bungalows for OAPs recently built in The Square, Long Lane.
